body:
### Describe the bug

While running the tests of numpy under TSAN the following data races are reported:

```console
==================
```

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

Run the tests of numpy using pytest-run-parallel as described in https://github.com/numpy/numpy/issues/30085

### Expected behaviour

No data races

### OS

All 

### Python version

3.14t

### Cython version

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

comment_data.body:
Based on a superficial skim-read, this doesn't feel like a Cython bug.

E.g. one of the errors is from `PyCode_NewEmpty` which really should be reentrant. I'm fairly sure the `const char*`s we pass in to it are genuinely const (but I'll double-check that later).  I'm struggling to see how we should be able to create a data race involving it.

title: [BUG] data races in code object caching and __Pyx_AddTraceback
